üíª Divide & Conquer Algorithm

function maxSubarrayDC(nums, left, right) {
  if (left === right) return nums[left]; // base case
  const mid = Math.floor((left + right) / 2);
  const leftMax = maxSubarrayDC(nums, left, mid);
  const rightMax = maxSubarrayDC(nums, mid+1, right);
  const crossMax = maxCrossingSum(nums, left, mid, right);
  return Math.max(leftMax, rightMax, crossMax);
}
function maxCrossingSum(nums, l, m, r) {
  let leftSum = -Infinity, sum = 0;
  for (i = m; i >= l; i--) { // go left from mid
    sum += nums[i]; leftSum = Math.max(leftSum, sum);
  }
  let rightSum = -Infinity; sum = 0;
  for (i = m+1; i <= r; i++) { // go right from mid+1
    sum += nums[i]; rightSum = Math.max(rightSum, sum);
  }
  return leftSum + rightSum;
}

üß† How Divide & Conquer Works

The maximum subarray must be in one of three places:

max = MAX( leftMax, rightMax, crossingMax )

1. Left Half: Entirely within indices [left...mid]
2. Right Half: Entirely within indices [mid+1...right]
3. Crossing: Spans both halves (must include mid and mid+1)

Time Complexity: T(n) = 2T(n/2) + O(n) = O(n log n)
Space Complexity: O(log n) for recursion stack
